data.enText: to bring back a situation or feeling that existed before

data.chText: 这些举措旨在恢复公众对经济的信心。
data.enText: The measures are intended to restore public confidence in the economy.

data.chText: 暴乱过后秩序很快得到了恢复。
data.enText: Order was quickly restored after the riots.

data.chText: 这样的善心使人又一次感到人性善良。
data.enText: Such kindness restores your faith in human nature (= makes you believe most people are kind) .
The operation restored his sight (= made him able to see again) .
to bring sb/sth back to a former condition, place or position

data.chText: 他现在完全恢复了健康。
data.enText: He is now fully restored to health.

data.chText: 我们想把这花园变得和过去一样美丽。
data.enText: We hope to restore the garden to its former glory (= make it as beautiful as it used to be) .
to repair a building, work of art, piece of furniture, etc. so that it looks as good as it did originally
Her job is restoring old paintings.
to bring a law, tradition, way of working, etc. back into use
Some people argue that the death penalty should be restored.
to give sth that was lost or stolen back to sb

data.chText: 警察已经把这幅油画归还给了它的合法主人。
data.enText: The police have now restored the painting to its rightful owner.

ex.chText: 他心脏病发作了，正在康复之中。
ex.enText: He's recovering from a heart attack.

ex.chText: 服务业已恢复到战前水平。
ex.enText: The service industry has recovered to pre-war levels.

ex.chText: 她过了几天才恢复知觉。
ex.enText: It was days before she recovered consciousness.

synonyms.bx: 指人从疾病等中康复过来或某事物恢复常态，常后接介词 from；也指恢复能力、知觉等。

ex.chText: 在他的帮助之下，这个家族恢复了往昔的影响力。
ex.enText: Under his help, the family regained/recovered its former influence.

ex.chText: 敌人重新控制了火车站。
ex.enText: The enemies have regained control of the train station.

ex.chText: 在聚会上看到竞争对手令他很惊讶，但他很快就恢复了平静。
ex.enText: He was surprised to meet his rival at the party, but he soon regained/recovered his composure.

synonyms.bx: 尤指重新得到某物或恢复某状态，常可与 recover 换用。

ex.chText: 政府花了3年时间才使经济完全复苏。
ex.enText: It took the government three years to restore the economy to full strength.

ex.chText: 这些运动会帮助你完全康复。
ex.enText: These exercises will help you restore your full health.

ex.chText: 这两个国家一年前恢复了外交关系。
ex.enText: These two countries restored diplomatic relations with each other one year ago.

ex.chText: 旨在让公众对教育体制恢复信心的改革得到了评论家褒贬不一的评价。
ex.enText: Reforms aimed at restoring public confidence in the education system has had mixed reviews from the critics.

synonyms.bx: 指使某事物恢复到从前的状态，也指恢复某种乐观的情绪。

tr: get or give new life or energy
example: The week at the spa restored me

tr: restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken

example: Restore the stolen painting to its rightful owner

tr: bring back into original existence, use, function, or position
example: restore the emperor to the throne

tr: return to its original or usable and functioning condition
example: restore the forest to its original pristine condition

value.def: To restore a situation or practice means to cause it to exist again.

example.ex: The army has recently been brought in to restore order...
example.tran: 最近军队被调来重整秩序。

example.ex: As they smiled at each other, harmony was restored again...
example.tran: 他们彼此微笑的时候，又恢复了往日的和睦。

example.ex: The death penalty was never restored.
His visit is expected to lead to the restoration of diplomatic relations...
example.tran: 人们期待他的出访会恢复外交关系。

example.ex: They were committed to the eventual restoration of a traditional monarchy.
example.tran: 他们致力于传统君主政体的最终恢复。

value.def: To restore someone or something to a previous condition means to cause them to be in that condition once again.

example.ex: We will restore her to health but it may take time...
example.tran: 我们会让她恢复健康，但可能需要一些时间。

example.ex: He said the ousted president must be restored to power...
example.tran: 他说被赶下台的总统必须重新掌权。

example.ex: His country desperately needs Western aid to restore its ailing economy.
example.tran: 他的国家急需西方援助以复苏其不景气的经济。

example.ex: I owe the restoration of my hearing to this remarkable new technique.
example.tran: 多亏了这项非凡的新技术，我恢复了听力。

value.def: When someone restores something such as an old building, painting, or piece of furniture, they repair and clean it, so that it looks like it did when it was new.

example.ex: ...experts who specialise in examining and restoring ancient parchments.
example.tran: 专门致力于检查和修复古代羊皮纸文稿的专家
整修得很漂亮的古镇广场

example.ex: I specialized in the restoration of old houses...
The bones were 'mislaid' during the seventeenth-century restorations.
example.tran: 这些骨头在17世纪的修复工作中被“放错了位置”。

value.def: If something that was lost or stolen is restored to its owner, it is returned to them.

example.ex: The following day their horses and goods were restored to them...
example.tran: 第二天，马匹和货物都归还给了他们。

example.ex: The looted property was restored and the chargé d'affaires was told that the soldiers responsible had been arrested.
example.tran: 被劫财物已经物归原主，代办得知对此负有责任的士兵已被逮捕。

trans: 数据库修复；数据库恢复；数据库还原
